Class Problem

java.lang.Object
Problem
public class Problem
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Problem​(int[][] costMatrix, Source[] sources, Destination[] destinations)
    Class constructor that creates an object with the given costMatrix, list of sources and list of destinations if there are duplicated sources or destinations in the given lists it will inform the user of this and the created object won't be created with the given list

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int[][] getCostMatrix()
    gets the cost matrix for this problem
    Destination[] getDestinations()
    gets the list of destinations for this problem
    Source[] getSources()
    gets the list of sources for this problem
    void print()
    prints the table corresponding to this problem similar to the one on the site the table consists of the cost matrix in the middle, first row contains the names of the sources and the last column on this row is named "SU" for supply, first column contains the names of the destinations and the last row is named "DE" for demand, the last column and row contain the respective supply/demand that associates to the source/destination names on the first row/column
    void setCostMatrix​(int[][] costMatrix)  
    void setDestinations​(Destination[] destinations)  
    void setSources​(Source[] sources)  
    java.lang.String toString()
    Overridden member of the Object class, used to print this object

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Problem

      public Problem​(int[][] costMatrix, Source[] sources, Destination[] destinations)
      Class constructor that creates an object with the given costMatrix, list of sources and list of destinations if there are duplicated sources or destinations in the given lists it will inform the user of this and the created object won't be created with the given list
      Parameters:
      costMatrix - the two dimensional array used to store the cost of transporting a unit of commodity from each source to each destination
      sources - the list of sources
      destinations - the list of destinations
      See Also:
      Main

  • Method Details

    • getCostMatrix

      public int[][] getCostMatrix()
      gets the cost matrix for this problem
      Returns:
      the two dimensional array associated with this problem

    • setCostMatrix

      public void setCostMatrix​(int[][] costMatrix)

    • getSources

      public Source[] getSources()
      gets the list of sources for this problem
      Returns:
      the array of sources associated with this problem

    • setSources

      public void setSources​(Source[] sources)

    • getDestinations

      public Destination[] getDestinations()
      gets the list of destinations for this problem
      Returns:
      the array of destinations associated with this problem

    • setDestinations

      public void setDestinations​(Destination[] destinations)

    • print

      public void print()
      prints the table corresponding to this problem similar to the one on the site the table consists of the cost matrix in the middle, first row contains the names of the sources and the last column on this row is named "SU" for supply, first column contains the names of the destinations and the last row is named "DE" for demand, the last column and row contain the respective supply/demand that associates to the source/destination names on the first row/column

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Overridden member of the Object class, used to print this object
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the composition of the object as in the cost matrix, the list of sources and the list of destinations
